Issues.Title: Remove point
Issues.Body:
## Proposed changes

- Remove `POINT` preferring `Point` which marshals the same

## Customer Impact

- Reduced allocations as we now use classes instead of structs

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- Minimal

## Test methodology

- Existing tests and #1530

Issues.Title: Remove pointstruct and friends
Issues.Body:
## Proposed changes

- Remove `POINTSTRUCT` preferring `Point` which marshals the same
- Remove `_POINTL` preferring `Point` which marshals the same
- Remove `tagPOINTF`, preferring `PointF` which marshals the same
- Remove `tagSIZEL`, preferring `Size` which marshals the same
- Remove `tagSIZE`, preferring `Size` which marshals the same
- Remove `SIZE`, preferring `Size` which marshals the same

## Customer Impact

- Reduced allocations as we now use classes instead of structs

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- Minimal

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Existing tests and #1530 

Extracted from #1508

Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Remove pointstruct and friends" (#1583)

Issues.Title: [Accessibility]: Incorrect control type of dropdown menu items
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.0.100-preview8-013392
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: Yes

**Original bug:**
- [Bug 937670: ](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/937670)[Screen Reader - SSMA - Create new project] Incorrect control type is defined for all menus like 'File and Edit and View and Tools...' on SSMA.
<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

**Problem description:**
- ToolStrip menu items have incorrect Accessibility ControlType property value when they are expanded. ToolStrip behavior should be like as in the Notepad.

**Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
- ToolStripDropDown item doesn't change his ControlType property value when it is expanded
- The navigation tree has an extra "toolbar".
- The Inspect can't get access to item's AccessibleObject when the mouse is over it

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49272759/62624995-04667080-b92d-11e9-8797-390fd59c030e.png)

**Expected behavior:**
- ToolStripDropDown item has "menu item" control type when it is collapsed.
- ToolStripDropDown item has "menu" control type when it is expanded and has separate space in the navigation tree.
- The navigation tree doesn't have an extra "toolbar".
- The Inspect can get access to item's AccessibleObject when the mouse is over it

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49272759/62625513-05e46880-b92e-11e9-8c82-050bebe9f81e.png)


**Minimal repro:**
- Create Core test app
- Add MenuStrip control
- Add menu items to MenuStrip control
- Add nested items to some dropdown MenuStrip item
- Open the Inspect and check the accessibility navigation tree
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Accessibility]: Incorrect control type of dropdown menu items" (#1582)

Issues.Title: Accessibility: [Inspect] The name of spinner under “PageUpDown” spinner in PrintPreview dialog should be consistent with .Net framework behavior
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: .Net 3.0 SDK Preview8 013656 build
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

**Repro Steps:**
1.	Open attached “PrintDemo” .Net Core app in VS
[PrintDemo.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/3476187/PrintDemo.zip)

2.	Build and run it, click the “Preview” button to show the Print Preview dialog
3.	Open Inspect and focus on the last one: ToolStripNumericUpDown in PrintPreviewToolStrip

**Actual behavior:** 
The name of spinner under “PageUpDown” spinner  is “ToolStripNumericUpDownControl” spinner, is not same as .net framework behavior. Please see following screenshot:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/62609968-8caa2e80-b8b7-11e9-887b-1de17c6b6841.png)


**Expected behavior:**
The name of spinner under “PageUpDown” spinner in Core should keep up with .Net framework, should be “NumericUpDown” spinner.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Accessibility: [Inspect] The name of spinner under “PageUpDown” spinner in PrintPreview dialog should be consistent with .Net framework behavior" (#1579)

Issues.Title: Accessibility: DataGridView cells in a ReadOnly DGV are reported as editable and Value.IsReadOnly is false in Inspect
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Accessibility: DataGridView cells in a ReadOnly DGV are reported as editable and Value.IsReadOnly is false in Inspect" (#1578)

Issues.Title: Consider enabling some xunit analyzers
Issues.Body:
We have done this in corefx and it's helped find some incorrect use of asserts and xunit attributes. Might be something the community is interested in doing - enabling one rule at a time as we have been doing.

original change https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/pull/38676
subsequent enablings https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/commits/master/src/CodeAnalysis.ruleset
more pending https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/pull/40079
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Consider enabling some xunit analyzers" (#1577)

Issues.Title: Remove unused .RESX files from Templates
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #1479

## Proposed changes
- remove `.resx` files form both language templates
- remove some unnecessary usings for the c# template 

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact
- no longer see extraneous usings in startup `Program.cs`
- no longer see unused `.resx` files in startup project

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk
- These are compiling just as they were before my change, so I see little risk. There is, of course, some risk that the templates would not work at all. We should have CTI validate the templates.

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->

Issues.Title: Adding new field to CloseReason Enum
Issues.Body:
Link to article:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.windows.forms.closereason?redirectedfrom=MSDN&view=netframework-4.8

Problem:
When you describe the fields of this Enumeration you state that the 'UserClosing' happens when: "The user is closing the form through the user interface (UI)". But this also happens when you use 'Close' method for a form in your code.
It would be great to distinguish the UI Closing from the code closing. 

Link to previous conversation about this issue: https://github.com/dotnet/dotnet-api-docs/issues/2844
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Adding new field to CloseReason Enum" (#1570)

Issues.Title: WIP: Fix MSO interfaces
Issues.Body:
This fixes MSO component interfaces so that they correctly match the COM interface definitions. It also hardens against being invoked with null pointers.

See related issue: #247

Need to define the interop scenarios with Office to fully test this. Wanted to make sure this PR is active for visibility. (And to prevent others from replicating the work I did here.)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "string.Copy deprecation removes a necessary use case with TextRenderer.MeasureText" (#1564)

Issues.Title: fix: `AccessibleObject` throws 'Value does not fall within the expected range.' creating `CollectionEditor`
Issues.Body:
Fixes #1556

## Proposed changes

- Verify that the underlying control contains children before attempting to query those.

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- None

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- None

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->




## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- manual runs with IDE attached breaking on `System.ArgumentException` to ensure no exceptions are thrown
- run Narrator to verify elements are still read correctly




###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](http://wpcp.azurewebsites.net/CodeFlowProtocolProxy2.php?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/1557)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix: `AccessibleObject` throws 'Value does not fall within the expected range.' creating `CollectionEditor`" (#1557)

Issues.Title: Add missing StructLayout
Issues.Body:
[StructLayout] inadvertently got removed from an interop class that is being used like a struct.

Audited the other interop classes- they all have the attribute.

fixes #1558

## Customer Impact

Moving the mouse after changing some properties without committing can throw.

## Regression? 

Yes

## Risk

Very low


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](http://wpcp.azurewebsites.net/CodeFlowProtocolProxy2.php?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/1563)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Add missing StructLayout" (#1563)

Issues.Title: The specified structure must be blittable or have layout information.
Issues.Body:

```

.NET Core runtimes installed:
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.All 2.1.11 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.All]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.All 2.1.12 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.All]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 2.1.11 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]

  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 3.0.0-preview8.19374.1 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 3.0.0-preview8.19381.6 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 2.1.11 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 2.1.12 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 3.0.0-preview7-27823-05 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]

  Microsoft.NETCore.App 3.0.0-preview8-27916-10 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 3.0.0-preview8-27917-07 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 3.0.0-preview8-28373-17 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 3.0.0-preview8-28376-02 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 3.0.0-preview8-28379-05 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 3.0.0-preview8-28380-08 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 3.0.0-preview8-28373-17 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App]
  Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 3.0.0-preview8-28380-08 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App]
```
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

**Problem description:**

Incorrect p/invoke definitions?

**Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4403806/62374120-e622fe00-b543-11e9-8e03-0d59dbdf6e2f.png)

```
System.ArgumentException
  HResult=0x80070057
  Message=The specified structure must be blittable or have layout information. 
  Source=System.Private.CoreLib
  StackTrace:
   at System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal.PtrToStructureHelper(IntPtr ptr, Object structure, Boolean allowValueClasses)
   at System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal.PtrToStructureHelper(IntPtr ptr, Type structureType)
```

**Expected behavior:**

No exceptions

**Minimal repro:**

1. Checkout 8437748b9bad0f8311218afb0f040dfaf8fdd737
2. (optional) Run `.\build-local.ps1` to have the latest sdk/app and necessary bindgings
3. Build and run `WinformsControlsTest` project
4. Update "Exception Settings" to break on `System.ArgumentException`
4. Click [Collection Editors] button
5. Edit "StringArray" property via the UI editor (ignore AEs in `AccessibilityObject`, if any - #1556)
6. Modify the selected value but do NOT commit it (i.e. don't hit <kbd>ENTER</kbd>)
7. Move mouse
6. Observe VS to break on the exception
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "The specified structure must be blittable or have layout information." (#1558)

Issues.Title: Referencing mshtml.dll in a .NET Core 3 WinForms project
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.0 Preview 7
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

**Problem description:**

I am having an issue with adding Microsoft.mshtml to my converted (net471) .NET Core 3 project.  With .NET Framework, I was able to go into Reference Manager -> Assemblies tab -> Extensions sub tab, then find Microsoft.mshtml. ![Capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/808932/62386440-d98fad00-b525-11e9-8fc4-66706d773fb7.PNG) As the assemblies tab does not exist in .NET Core 3 projects, I looked for a package on NuGet, but was unable to find anything from Microsoft (I tried https://www.nuget.org/packages/Unofficial.Microsoft.mshtml/, which compiles, but fails at runtime).


**Actual behavior:** 
Expect to be able to find a NuGet package (or another manner of adding the reference) for Microsoft.mshtml.

**Expected behavior:**
Unable to find a way to add Microsoft.mshtml to a .NET Core 3 application.



**Minimal repro:**
N/A.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Referencing mshtml.dll in a .NET Core 3 WinForms project" (#1559)
